items.title: Brasília, a Capital City That’s a Place Apart
items.abstract: The city, a planned showcase for modernistic design, has a distinctly un-Brazilian nature, standing in jarring contrast to the nation’s unpredictability.

items.title: California Today: The Rise of a Design Capital
items.abstract: Thursday: California as a brand, the power of social media to rewire society, and recognizing Chicano Park.

items.title: Crackdown Sweeps Ethiopia’s Capital as War Draws Near
items.abstract: Government forces were going to door to door in the Ethiopian capital, rounding up ethnic Tigrayans, members of the same ethnic group as the rebels closing in.

items.title: Washington, the Nation’s Capital, Moves to Reopen. Washington, the City, Is Not Ready.
items.abstract: As the coronavirus hits the White House, Congress and D.C.’s poorest areas, many across the region are asking the Trump administration to proceed with caution.

items.title: Italian Cities Vie for Culture Capital Status
items.abstract: Delegations from 21 Italian cities have gone to Rome to try to convince a panel of 13 experts that their city deserves to be the 2019 European Capital of Culture.
